properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Warning issued January 5 at 2:30AM PST until January 5 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...South to southwest winds 20 to 30 kt will diminish to
southwest to west 15 to 20 kt by Sunday afternoon, then increase
again to south to southwest 20 to 25 kt late Sunday night
through Monday. Seas will be 11 to 13 feet at 10 to 11 seconds
initially, building to 13 to 14 feet at 12 seconds Sunday
evening, then subsiding to 11 to 13 feet at 12 seconds Monday.

* WHERE...Initially the very steep seas will be beyond 2 NM from
around Reedsport north with steep seas over the remainder of the
zone. However, very steep seas will spread over the entire zone
late Sunday morning through Sunday evening. Seas will then
become steep over the entire zone Sunday night into Monday
morning. Small craft advisory winds will affect the entire zone
until late Sunday morning, and again late Sunday night through
Monday.

* WHEN...For the Hazardous Seas Warning, until 10 PM PST this
evening. For the Small Craft Advisory, until 10 AM PST this
morning. For the Small Craft Advisory, from 10 PM this evening
to 4 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Bar crossing will become especially
treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Recreational boaters should remain in port. Commercial vessels
should prepare for very steep seas and consider remaining in port
until conditions improve.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST MONDAY
